newsitem.title: USA: Clinton-Kohl plan to slim down their appetites.
newsitem.headline: Clinton-Kohl plan to slim down their appetites.

text.p: President Bill Clinton and German Chancellor Helmut Kohl plan to slim down their appetites next week when they get together to eat at a resturant where they consumed impressive amounts of food once before.

Clinton and Kohl plan to have dinner together on Wednesday night at Filomena's Resturant in the Georgetown section of Washington, the same spot they visited a few years ago for a feast of what were best described as "heavy Italian foods."
"The president is on a diet and the chancellor is facing a campaign," said White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry, suggesting that candidates traditionally shed a few pounds when facing voters.
"I think it's going to be a somewhat more modest occasion than their first encounter at that venue," McCurry said on Friday.
